00001 #!/opt/local/bin/python
00002 #!/usr/bin/python
00003 
00004 """
00005 Author: Will Holcomb <wholcomb@gmail.com>
00006 Date: 2006/04/22

00008 Test program to take a html document and isolate the input element values
00009 """
00010 
00011 import sys
00012 import re
00013 
00014 if len(sys.argv) <= 1:
00015     print "Usage %s <filename.html>" % sys.argv[0]
00016     print " Takes a html form and prints out the input values"
00017     sys.exit(1)
00018 
00019 INPUTRE = re.compile("<input [^>]*name=\"(?P<name>[^\"]*)\" [^>]*value=\"(?P<value>[^\"]*)\"", re.DOTALL)
00020 INPUTRE = re.compile("(?P<tag><input (?:[^>]*(?:(?:type=\"(?P<type>.*?)\")|(?:name=\"(?P<name>.*?)\")|(?:value=\"(?P<value>.*?)\")))*[^>]*>)", re.DOTALL)
00021 INPUTRE = re.compile("<input([^>]*)>", re.DOTALL)
00022 VALUEPAIRRE = re.compile("(\\w+)(?:=(?:\"([^\"]*)\"|(\\S+)))?", re.DOTALL)
00023 for filename in sys.argv[1:]:
00024     print "Processing: %s" % filename
00025     data = open(filename, "r").read()
00026     params = {}
00027     for input in INPUTRE.findall(data):
00028         properties = {}
00029         for pair in VALUEPAIRRE.findall(input):
00030             print pair
00031             properties[pair[0].lower()] = pair[1] + pair[2]
00032         if properties.has_key('type') and properties['type'].lower() == "checkbox" and not properties.has_key('checked'):
00033             pass
00034         elif properties.has_key('name') and properties.has_key('value'):
00035             params[properties['name']] = properties['value']
00036         elif properties.has_key('name'):
00037             params[properties['name']] = None
00038         elif properties.has_key('type') and (properties['type'] == "reset" or properties['type'] == "submit"):
00039             pass
00040         else:
00041             print "Couldn't interpret: '%s'" % input
00042     print params
